section1.name: Speed, Time, and Distance
content: Speed is defined as the rate of travel to cover a certain distance. It is expressed in m/s, km/hr, etc.
Time is defined as the duration for which traveling has been done to cover a certain distance. It is expressed in seconds, hours, etc.
Distance is defined as the length of the path for which traveling has been done. It is expressed in meters, kilometers, etc.
Formula for Speed: Speed = Distance / Time.
Formula for Time: Time = Distance / Speed.
Formula for Distance: Distance = Speed × Time.

section2.name: Ratios of Speed, Distance, and Time
content: If the ratio of the speeds of A and B is a : b, then the ratio of the times taken by them to cover the same distance will be b : a.

section3.name: Average Speed
content: The formula for average speed when the total distance and total time are known is: Average Speed = Total Distance / Total Time.
In case of two different speeds for the same distance, the average speed is given by: Average Speed = (2 × Speed1 × Speed2) / (Speed1 + Speed2).
